title: Tyler’s Portfolio

✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

title: About
text: I am currently a Junior at the University of Wisconsin-Madison studying Data Science and Economics. This is a place for me to showcase my projects I have been working on in my free time and in class.

title: Projects
text:
Simulated entire 2022 FIFA World Cup using a Bradley-Terry Model based on data scraped from previous 10 year match results in R. Formulated group stage and knockout round simulations with visualizations and outcomes.
View Project



Used data from 2024 MLB season to find out if pitch sequencing can have a positive effect on a pitcher’s expected runs saved.
View Project



Gathered data from over a year’s worth of workouts, including heart rate, pace, percieved exertion, and more.
View Project

title: Tyler’s Portfolio
text:
My Most Recent Workout

library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(glue)
library(rStrava)

workouts <- read_csv("data/strava_activities.csv")

Rows: 405 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): activity_name, type
dbl  (3): distance_miles, moving_time_min, pace_min_mile
date (1): date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

recent <- workouts %>%
  arrange(desc(date)) %>%
  slice(1)

glue("**{recent$type}** — {recent$distance_miles} miles in {recent$moving_time_min} minutes on {recent$date}.")

**Run** — 4.35 miles in 35.6 minutes on 2025-11-07.
